channel.title: How do i add lunar altar?
channel.description: how do i add a lunar altar im using project sanity base server. when i try add the object id and the position it doesnt go there after i compile. can somebody help me on teamviewer or something add me on burnleyladz@hotmail.co.uk i want the position to be at character-posx = 3104, character-posy = 3508. i will give rsbot with scripts and co-owner of my server or admin.

item.title: How do i add lunar altar?
item.dc:creator: @deathscapepkz deathscapepkz
item.description:
@deathscapepkz wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:4, topic:365798”]If you are using delta, go into client.java search for makeglobalobject. You will find a list. Put this in that list and you should be good.

makeGlobalObject(3104, 3508, 410,0,10); // Lunar Altar
What it means:
makeGlobalObject(X Coordinate, Y Coordinate, Object ID, Facing Position, Don’t worry about this); // Lunar Altar

If you are using the Project Insanity Source search for objectmanager.java in your source files. Once you open that, search for loadCustomSpawns. You will see a list again. Add this to that list:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(410, 3104, 3508, 0, 10); // Lunar Altar
What it means:
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(Object ID, X Coordinate, Y Coordinate, Facing Position, Don’t worry about this); // Lunar Altar[/quote]

im an using project insanity base server forgot to mention that i modified my other message.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add lunar altar?

item.title: How do i add lunar altar?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

If you are using delta, go into client.java search for makeglobalobject. You will find a list. Put this in that list and you should be good.

makeGlobalObject(3104, 3508, 410,0,10); // Lunar Altar
What it means:
makeGlobalObject(X Coordinate, Y Coordinate, Object ID, Facing Position, Don’t worry about this); // Lunar Altar

If you are using the Project Insanity Source search for objectmanager.java in your source files. Once you open that, search for loadCustomSpawns. You will see a list again. Add this to that list:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(410, 3104, 3508, 0, 10); // Lunar Altar
What it means:
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(Object ID, X Coordinate, Y Coordinate, Facing Position, Don’t worry about this); // Lunar Altar

item.title: How do i add lunar altar?
item.dc:creator: @deathscapepkz deathscapepkz
item.description:
@deathscapepkz wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:2, topic:365798”]Need more information such as is it a 317? 508?

Someone had a similar problem to this yesterday, if your server has a Bin folder. Move the compiled file to there (replace the current one). Also, make sure you have no errors when you’ve compiled.[/quote]

it is a 317.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add lunar altar?

item.title: How do i add lunar altar?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Need more information such as is it a 317? 508?

Someone had a similar problem to this yesterday, if your server has a Bin folder. Move the compiled file to there (replace the current one). Also, make sure you have no errors when you’ve compiled.

Read full topic
